transcription.text:
Speaker 1: Hey Bruce, KT Goodrich again. Thanks for holding. As a veteran, I take a lot of pride in all

Speaker 2: of my work, bud, and this really grinds my gears, but I did exactly what you wanted. First thing

Speaker 1: I did is I put a stop to any and all monthly shipments. I overrode the system and I put

Speaker 2: a stop to any and all monthly refills and I also put a stop to any and all monthly charges.

Speaker 1: I paused your prescription and I noticed in your chart that what he sent you, I don't

Speaker 2: know what you wanted. Did you want the basic Viagra? Because that's what it says on your

Speaker 1: chart. Do you want the AGV? Because if they weren't working and you paid for all this,

Speaker 2: that's not fair to you, bud. But on your chart, it doesn't say. It doesn't say AGV. Most nine

Speaker 1: out of ten men that work with us want the AGV, not the basic Viagra. This damn thing

Speaker 2: says, and I read it to you, it said FDA approved 50 milligrams Viagra, Pfizer Viagra. But we

Speaker 1: have three Viagras. We have the blue pill, $100 pill. We had the basic Viagra, which

Speaker 2: you got 30 of them over the last three months. And then we have the AGV, the one that's a

Speaker 1: time release that no one has exclusive. So since you're already baked into about what

Speaker 2: three refills that weren't working, I'll just replace those to make you whole. Don't worry

Speaker 1: about any money. I'll send a bill to Dr. Tu and let him eat that. You know, I'll have

Speaker 2: him, I'll fill his clinic and then I'll replace everything and just take down my extension

Speaker 1: and just deal with me. Don't worry about any monthly or any charges at all. I put a stop

Speaker 2: to that. I'm just going to send you 30 to make you whole, bud, because we're Americans,

Speaker 1: you know, and this as a veteran, you know, like I, huh? What was I being charged for

Speaker 2: this that I didn't ask for? So you, you were, there's a prescription for 50 milligrams of

Speaker 2: So you wanted, what am I being billed? It was 63 bucks. I didn't authorize that. It

Speaker 1: says here, when I looked at the terms and conditions further down, there's a clause

Speaker 2: there and Dr. Tu has ordered the pharmacy to send you refills on his behalf. It's a

Speaker 1: standard practice. But I, the care, the question is, I can't refund this because we're just

Speaker 2: hearing about this now. And when I'm doing my due diligence, I'd be happy to do replacements

Speaker 1: because we can of what you want in right for free and we can call it a day. I don't want

Speaker 2: anything and I don't want to pay for anything. That's exactly. I don't want to do bills.

Speaker 1: That's exactly right. And I don't even know who they're billing. Are they, are they billing

Speaker 2: a credit card of mine? I didn't know they had a credit card. Wait, wait a minute. So

Speaker 1: Bruce Wagner, can you confirm your date of birth, sir? February 20th, 1954. And then

Speaker 2: your day, your shipping address. 1539 Riverside Drive North Hudson, Wisconsin, 54016. And

Speaker 1: then one last thing, your email. Cause maybe you've been compromised. Who knows? Bruce,

Speaker 2: Bruce.c.wangeratgmail.com. I see a Bruce.c.wangeratgmail.com. That's correct. That is correct. I don't know

Speaker 1: why. Have you ever, ever at all wanted the AGV bag or the one that releases in 11 minutes,

Speaker 2: 12 minutes, it goes about 13, 14 hours. It's the new white diamond pill that, that no one

Speaker 1: else can make except Pfizer. And we're exclusive to prescribe them to our doctors. Cause that's

Speaker 2: what I wanted. I wanted to try one pill to see how it worked. I never asked for refills.

Speaker 1: Hmm. I completely understand. And that's why I was expressing to you. I put a stop to that

Speaker 2: because I don't want to be, I don't want to be billed this $60 times three. No, what I'm

Speaker 1: saying to you is that you have received refills and you're saying that you wanted to try them,

Speaker 2: I wanted to try one pill. I didn't want to try 30 pills. Well, with all due respect. Yeah,

Speaker 1: but with all due respect, sir, with pharma, it's not a supplement with pharmaceuticals.

Speaker 2: When a doctor writes a prescription, they can't write a prescription for one pill. They write

Speaker 1: you for a 30 day supply, which is the minimum is 10 pills. And you, you probably know that you

Speaker 2: probably know that with any medication out there in the world. But they keep sending me refills.

Speaker 1: Yes. I've had two refills since the original order. Correct. And that's why I put a stop to

Speaker 2: that. And I don't want to pay for the refills. Of course you don't because, but there is a clause

Speaker 1: saying that you agreed to, and I, I'm not trying to butt heads with you. I'm here to support you.

Speaker 2: And the best I could do is exactly what you want. And I put a stop to any and all month

Speaker 1: refills. And then I pause your prescription and you're saying I'm sensing that these didn't work

Speaker 2: within a 30 minute period or go longer than six hours, right? I didn't even try it yet. Oh, okay.

Speaker 1: So try these out, but I'm not sure what you got. If it was the basic or was the AGE,

Speaker 2: which one did you want? I don't want anything. You just said you wanted to try one. So it's,

Speaker 1: that's conflicting information. I changed my mind. I don't want to try anything. Sure. I mainly don't

Speaker 2: want to bill anything. I don't have $60 times three. I'm broke. I completely understand. We're

Speaker 1: living 20 cents to the dollar. Look, sir. And I, I get that. I completely understand. I'm glad

Speaker 2: that you're calling in to address this because you haven't tried it. Try it out. See, see how

Speaker 1: you love it. Then we can go from there. Here's the main thing is I don't want any new pills to

Speaker 2: be sent at all, which you said you've stopped. I don't want to be billed $60 anymore. And I don't

Speaker 1: want to be billed for the last two times that you've billed me $60. So if you have those pills

Speaker 2: and you haven't opened up the package, yes, do you be how I'll be happy to guide you Bruce through

Speaker 1: the process. And all I'm saying is I'd be happy and thrilled and to support you through the

Speaker 2: process. And I'll instruct you on how to get that back and you stay with me and I'll get you back

Speaker 1: that money. Copy that. Are you in line with that? So I can help you. This is a, how we serve one

Speaker 2: another, sir. We're Americans, you know, we definitely not going to Venezuela, you know,

Speaker 1: and, and, you know, when doctors write a prescription, you know how it goes. They just

Speaker 2: tell the damn pharmacy to fill these refills and they go, but, um, I don't know. I don't have

Speaker 1: access. I don't have access to that, bud. There's not enough money in my checking account to cover

Speaker 2: this. Hmm. Let me see if I can hold your line and see if I can access that information by my admin

Speaker 1: team. All right. One moment. Hold your line for 30 seconds. We'll work through this. All right,

Speaker 2: Bruce. Okay. All right. Thank you. One moment.
